Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2013 05:08PM Snowtimedreaming wrote: There is some great info on cysts within this site and others. Basically cysts are generally benign and this is a good thing. I can certainly understand your trepidation and concern given your previous Hodgkins lymphoma as well as your doctors approach. I am pleased that he is being thorough in his reveiws and his request for scans. I am not sure if you know that most cysts will flare prior to your period simply due to hormonal influences and settle down post period. I trust that this will happen for you and thats all there is to it.Â  Also I had my scan done on a Friday morning and went back late Friday afternoon to collect the report. I couldn't wait for the report so of course I looked and went to my doctor directly! You could phone and ask when the report will be ready and go back and collect it if you like. Please keep us posted. Regards Y
Posts.Title: Can cysts be felt? llhines38 SpecialK

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2013 04:41PM Snowtimedreaming wrote: Hi Cysts can present as a lump or just be there. I too have multiple cysts and was not necessarily aware of how many until ultrasound. From a lot of reading most cysts are generally benign by nature. Did the ultrasound report simply note that they were there and were they reported as normal? Regards Y
Posts.Title: Can cysts be felt? llhines38 SpecialK

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2013 10:10AM Snowtimedreaming wrote: Hi Sue We are currently discussing this in "Waiting" so if you go to the end of the thread Beesie and others have just provided some really good info and advice that might answer some of your questions. Its also a group of ladies in the process of waiting for final results and diagnosis. Regards Y
